bib_record.title: -THE THERMAL CROSS SECTION AND THE RESONANCE INTEGRAL OF PA-231.ACTIVATION DETERMINATION WITHOUT USING A CD-FILTER-.

free_txt: THESIS  DM-6909(1976),TECHNICAL
UNIVERSITY OF MUNICH. THE SAME RESULTS ARE
INCLUDED  (IN GERMAN).
CALCULATION OF G-FACTOR FOR
(N,G)- AND (N,F)-REACTIONS OF NON 1/V-NUCLIDES.
.BECAUSE OF THE LOW ENERGY RESONANCES AT 0.396 EV AND
0.494 EV OF PA-231, THE CONTRIBUTION OF THESE RESO-
NANCES TO THE RESONANCE INTEGRAL (IT IS ABOUT 76
PER CENT) WILL BE REDUCED WHEN A CADMIUM FILTER IS
USED (CADMIUM-CUT-OFF-ENERGY = 0.55 EV).
.IN ORDER TO MEASURE THE TOTAL RESONANCE INTEGRAL
(FROM AN ENERGY GREATER THAN ABOUT 0.2 EV) A
NEW METHOD IS DEVELOPED WHICH IS BASED ON IRRADIA-
TIONS IN TWO DIFFERENT NEUTRON SPECTRA WITH KNOWN
NEUTRON TEMPERATURE AND EPITHERMAL INDEX.
.THE NEUTRON TEMPERATURE WAS MEASURED USING THE
NEUTRON TEMPERATURE DETECTOR LU-176 (FOR THESE
MEASUREMENTS SEE THESIS DM-6909).
.THE EPITHERMAL COMPONENT WAS MEASURED USING
AU-197 AND CO-59 AS MONITORS.
.THE S0-FACTOR (WESTCOTT FORMALISM) WAS CALCULATED
FROM THE RELATION S0=(G2*(R1/R2)-G1)/(F1-(R1-R2)*F2)
WHERE R,G,F ARE THE INDUCED ACTIV. (EITHER OF PA-232
OR OF U-232),THE G-FACTOR AND THE EPITHERMAL INDEX
OF THE IRRADIATION POSITIONS 1 AND 2,RESPECTIVELY.
.THE G-FACTORS ARE REPORTED IN REF. RCA,22(1975),128.
.FOR COMPARISON  THE CADMIUM METHOD  HAS BEEN ALSO
USED.
.THE SPECTRUM OF THE IRRADIATION POSITIONS HAS A
KNOWN 1/E FORM.
.BECAUSE OF THE THIN SAMPLES NO CORRECTION FOR
SELF SHIELDING AND SELF ABSORPTION IS NEEDED.
.NEW METHOD FOR MEASUREMENT OF THERMAL CROSS SECTION
AND RES. INTEGRAL OF NUCLIDES WHOSE DIFFERENTIAL
CROSS SECTIONS DO  NOT OBEY  THE 1/V-LAW BELOW
THE CADMIUM-CUT-OFF-ENERGY.
.A COMPILATION  OF THE THERMAL CROSS SECTIONS AND
RESONANCE INTEGRALS OF PA-231 IS ALSO GIVEN.
GE(LI)-DETECTORS COUPLED TO A ND4420 ANALYSER.
THE ALPHA ACTIVITY OF PA-231 AND U-232 WAS
MEASURED WITH A HOME-MADE LIQUID SCINTILLATION
COUNTER.
.THE UNCERTAINTY IN THE G-FACTORS OF PA-231 (ABOUT
+-2 PER CENT) AND THE UNCERTAINTY OF EPITHERMAL
INDICES CONTRIBUTE TO THE THERMAL CROSS SECTION
THE MAXIMUM DEVIATIONS OF 4.1 PER CENT  AND 6.0
PER CENT,RESPECTIVELY.
.THE ALPHA MEASUREMENTS WITH THE SCINTILLATION COUNTER
HAVE AN ACCURACY OF +- 2 PER CENT.
.THE HALF LIFE OF PA-232 AND THE INTENSITIES OF THE
MEASURED GAMMA RAYS ARE KNOWN WITH GOOD ACCURACY.
.STANDARD DEVIATION.
.UNCERTAINTIES IN THE THERMAL CROSS SECTIONS AND
RESONANCE INTEGRALS OF THE STANDARDS.
PNEUMATIC POSITIONS,REFLECTOR AND ROTATING
DISK FACILITY OF FRM-REACTOR IN MUNICH.
ACTIVATION.
.DEVELOPMENT OF A NEW METHOD WITHOUT USING A CADMIUM
FILTER (SEE ANALYSIS).
.CADMIUM FILTER MEASUREMENTS,WESTCOTT FORMALISM.
THERMAL CROSS SECTION = 98.8+-0.3B,
RES.INTEGRAL INCLUDING THE 1/V-PART = 1551 +-12B.
THERMAL CROSS SECTION = 37.2 +0.6B,
RES.INTEGRAL INCLUDING THE 1/V-PART = 71.1 +- 4.0B.
.FROM A STOCK SOLUTION OF PA-231 IN 0.05 N HF (AFTER
PURIFICATION WITH ANION EXCHANGE) AN ALIQUOT
CONTAINING ABOUT 1 MG PA-231 IS DRIED ON A SMALL
PIECE OF PURE AL-FOIL.
.FOR THE STANDARDS AU-AL-ALLOY WIRE (AU, 0.132 PER
CENT) AND CO-AL-ALLOY WIRE (CO, 0.564 PER CENT)
HAVE BEEN USED.
.TAKEN FROM J.INORG.NUCL.CHEM., 36(1974)1447.
METHOD WITHOUT USING CADMIUM-FILTER.
CADMIUM-FILTER METHOD.
